dialogues.speaker: MR. GREEN
dialogues.text: (still squeaking) Fine. (he pulls himself together, and lowers his voice two octaves) Fine: Come with me, officer, I'll show you the Dining Room - or the Kitchen - or the Ballroom. And he leads him away, the COP going somewhat reluctantly his eyes lingering on the Study and Lounge doors. As the COP and MR. GREEN disappear into the Dining Room, MISS SCARLET turns to the OTHERS.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SCARLET
dialogues.text: (softly) Okay. Listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COP and MR. GREEN come into the Dining Room.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GREEN
dialogues.text: This is the Dining Room.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (heavy sarcasm) _ No kidding. What's going on in those two rooms? MR. GREEN's voice is still high-pitched in terror. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. GREEN
dialogues.text: What two rooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISS SCARLET is talking to MRS. WHITE and COLONEL MUSTARD in front of the bodies of THE COOK and MR. BODDY on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SCARLET
dialogues.text: Make it look convincing. And she grabs a bottle of brandy from the sideboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISS SCARLET and PROFESSOR PLUM whizz across the Hall and into the Lounge just as MR. GREEN and the COP emerge from the Dining Room. The COP points at the Study and Lounge doors.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Those two rooms.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GREEN
dialogues.text: (a trifle hysterically) Oh, those two rooms!

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Yes. He walks purposefully towards the Study. MR. GREEN hurrie after him, grabs his arm, and stops him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GREEN
dialogues.text: Officer, I don't think you should go in there. The COP stops walking and stares -at him. CoP (suspiciously) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GREEN
dialogues.text: Um... (wildly) Well, because... because... oh, it's all too shocking. (CONTINUED)
Oy 101 CONTINUED: The COP brushes MR. GREEN aside, goes to the Study and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are off. The PHONOGRAPH is PLAYING, softly. "I Ain't Got No Body,” an old 78 rpm record. The COP switches the light. On the sofa MRS. WHITE is sitting on the knee of the dead MR. BODDY. She is kissing him on the mouth. He appears, from the COP'S POV to be embracing her - but we can see that his arms and hands are being manipulated by MRS. WHITE-like a big puppet. The COP sees this, and his eyes turn to another couple: the COOK is standing up in a corner, her arms around COLONEL MUSTARD, and he appears.to be kissing her. The COOK's hands are moving through his hair. NEW ANGLE . In the corner, we see that COOK's hands are behind her back, and MRS. PEACOCK is concealed behind COOK - and it MRS, PEACOCK's hands which are caressing COLONEL MUSTARD. The COP turns to MR. GREEN, who is watching open-mouthed. CoP It's not all. that shocking. Folks are just having a good time. He leaves the room, followed by MR. GREEN. MRS. PEACOCK comes out from behind the dead COOK. She is looking demented.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PEACOCK
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!! MRS. WHITE stops kissing MR. BODDY.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PEACOCK _
dialogues.text: How could you kiss that... thing?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WHITE
dialogues.text: (shrugs) It's like kissing my first husband.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PEACOCK
dialogues.text: (nastily) ~ - Before or after you cut his head off? ae wt : (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISS SCARLET is pouring brandy into the mouth of the dead MOTORIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COP and MR. GREEN cross the Hall and open the Lounge Door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISS SCARLET and PROFESSOR PLUM are in an embrace. The MOTORIST is now lying back in a chair, his head injur not visible from the front. A half empty bottle of brandy has his fingers curled round it. The COP enters. MISS SCARLET and PROFESSOR PLUM separate. The COP eyes them. MR. GREEN is still open-mouthed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. He sees the MOTORIST and crosses over to him. He sees the bottle. He bends down and sniffs his breath. CoP (continuing) He's drunk. Dead drunk.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SCARLET
dialogues.text: (nodding) Dead right. The COP shakes the MOTORIST. The bottle slips to the floo The MOTORIST, not.surprisingly, doesn't wake up when shak The COP bends down towards his ear. CoP I hope you're not going to drive home?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR PLUM
dialogues.text: He won't be driving home, officer, I promise you that.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (looking up) Someone will give him a lift?

dialogues.speaker: MISS SCARLET
dialogues.text: Yes, we'll get a car for him - a long black car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR. PLUM
dialogues.text: (hastily) A limousine. The COP nods. MR. GREEN is still Open-mouthed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADSWORTH is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: WADSWORTH
dialogues.text: Goodbye. He replaces the receiver, and, remembering his situation, hurries out into the Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADSWORTH sees the COP and MR. GREEN coming out of the Lounge.

dialogues.speaker: WADSWORTH
dialogues.text: Officer... - cop ‘You're too late. I've seen everything. * WADSWORTH is shattered by this statement. As always, the dialogue maintains a considerable pace - therein lies the humor.

dialogues.speaker: WADSWORTH
dialogues.text: You have? in despair) I can explain everything. CoP You don't need to.

dialogues.speaker: WADSWORTH
dialogues.text: (dazed) I don't?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Don't worry. ‘There's nothing illegal about any of this.

dialogues.speaker: WADSWORTH
dialogues.text: Are you sure? * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CoP No. This is America.

dialogues.speaker: WADSWORTH
dialogues.text: I see. CoP It's a free country, didn't you know?

dialogues.speaker: WADSWORTH
dialogues.text: I didn't know it was that free? Slight pause. . CoP May I use the phone. now?

dialogues.text: Certainly. Delighted, he shows the COP into the Library. The COP goes in, and WADSWORTH locks the door. Again he leaves the key in the lock. we 107 INT. dialogues.speaker: MR. GREEN
dialogues.text: Why did you lock him in there again?

dialogues.speaker: WADSWORTH
dialogues.text: We didn't finish searching the house.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR PLUM
dialogues.text: (he looks at his watch) But.we're running out of time. Only fifteen minutes till the police come.

dialogues.text: The police came already.

dialogues.text: Come on. And they hurry up the main stairs. WADSWORTH and MRS. WHITE follow. We MOVE WITH them, TO a HIGH AND VERY WIDE SHOT as they all come up the stairs, and simultaneously MRS. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLONEL MUSTARD and MISS SCARLET enter the Kitchen. COLONEL MUSTARD eyes a different cupboard door. He moves steadily toward it, opens it -- and a fold-up ironing board drops out and hits him on the head. He reels. Then he looks around. His eye is caught by the cupboard out of which the COOK fell. He opens the door. It looks like a big broom cupboard. Then, with an eerie creak, the back wall of the cupboard moves -- and opens. Another secret passage!

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL MUSTARD
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SCARLET
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. Where does this one go?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL MUSTARD
dialogues.text: Let's find out.

dialogues.text: COLONEL MUSTARD and MISS SCARLET move along the tunnel.
